DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether the patient is currently receiving pain medication.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the current administration of pain medication.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli and generally received by specialized nerve endings.:biologically active substance, including those intended for use in diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of disease or other abnormalities, for the relief of suffering, or control or improvement of a physical or mental state; includes biological products.

Concepts.definition: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Are you receiving treatments
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are you receiving treatments or medications for your pain?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are you receiving treatments or medications for your pain?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did you take any other pain medications over the last hour? (circle 'Yes' or 'No')

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did you take any other pain medications over the last two hours? (circle 'Yes' or 'No')

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Please list all of the pain medications (other than the study medication) and dosages that you used today

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did you use any medications for PAIN in the past 24 HOURS? (circle 'Yes' or 'No')

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient take any pain medication(s) during this 7 - day period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient receive non-narcotic pain reliever on a day of assessment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient receiving oral medication for pain during this reporting period?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Therapy Ind-2 2018279v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
